metadata.title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
metadata.description: How an insignificant ape conquered the world.
metadata.author: Yuval Noah Harari

content.synopsis: Seventy thousand years ago, there were at least six different human species on earth. They were insignificant animals, whose ecological impact was less than that of fireflies or jellyfish. Today, there is only one. Us. Homo Sapiens. How did we do it? We bought into myths.

intro.title: The Animal That Became a God
intro.text: We are not special because of our tools or our intelligence. We are special because we are the only animal that can cooperate flexibly in large numbers. And we can do this because we are the only animal that can believe in things that exist purely in our own imagination: gods, nations, money, and human rights.

cognitive.title: I. The Cognitive Revolution
cognitive.subtitle: The Tree of Knowledge
cognitive.text: The secret was not describing reality ('There is a lion'), but creating new realities ('The lion is our guardian spirit'). This allowed us to trust strangers and build cities.

agricultural.title: II. The Agricultural Revolution
agricultural.subtitle: History's Biggest Fraud
agricultural.text: The Agricultural Revolution certainly enlarged the sum total of food, but the extra food did not translate into a better diet or more leisure. Rather, it translated into population explosions and pampered elites.
insights: Wheat domesticated us, not vice versa
agricultural.quote: We did not domesticate wheat. Wheat domesticated us.

scientific.title: III. The Scientific Revolution
scientific.subtitle: The Discovery of Ignorance
scientific.text: Premodern traditions asserted that everything important was already known. Modern science began when humans admitted: We don't know.

conclusion.title: The Future
conclusion.text: We are now standing on the threshold of heaven and hell. History is still undecided.
conclusion.final_word: IS THERE ANYTHING MORE DANGEROUS THAN DISSATISFIED GODS?

wheat.title: THE LUXURY TRAP
wheat.instruction: Planting wheat provides more calories but demands more labor.
wheat.trap_warning: TRAP ACTIVATED: YOU ARE WORKING HARDER.
